main.name: Leila Rhazaoui
main.description: I am in a complete professionnal reconversion in Web/Software developpement, trained in Front-End, NodeJS, Javascript, ReactJS, at the Wild Code School based in Paris.
main.bio: I was born in the U.K, and grew up in Guinea, Niger, Cameroun, Senegal and Morocco thanks to my father's position in the United Nations (UNDP) and his assignements in these countriesk, which has given me the skills to learn new languages and adapt, being bilingual English/French since birth. I started my professional life as a bartender, and tried different paths, before  finally finding my way and love for computer programming. I have been learning web development with full commitment and passion, driven by the need to work with something I'm really intersted in. I am actively searching to join a team to gain some work experience, train, and learn more about new languages, frameworks, technos, etc.. My world travelling experiences has given me an open mind, an ease to adapt in all situations, and a strong team spirit.
main.contactmessage: Have a question? or a project? I'd love to hear from you! Hit me up!

resume.skillmessage: Here is a list of the few techs I've loved to learn, and learned to love!

education.description: We have had an intense training in web, software and application developpement. We have focused and trained mainly in HTML/CSS, Javascript, ReactJS, NodeJS, Git. I have taken the opportunity, during this time, to explore a bit more : MySql, C++, Bootstrap, Phpmyadmin, and more. I have truely found a passion for coding.

I do love to code, and, as a food enthusiast, I have followed a long distance training in culinary arts a few years ago. I have work experience in the kitchen, and I wanted to push my love and curiosity for food even further.

Daughter of a Yogi, I have always been surrounded by this peacefull practice. Through this intensive training, in Neuville-aux-Bois, France, I have discovered many things. I truely am gratefull for this experience, as it has now a incredible positive effect in my life. I am now able to teach others the wonders of Sivananda Yoga, whether it be the physical, the mental, or the spiritual approach. This comes in very handy when stressfull situations occure, in the personal and professional life.

work.title: Barman of steel
work.description: As I am in a full professionnal reconversion, I can only share my past experiences. Most of the being a top of the notch Bartender ! My last bartending experience has been Mc Bride's, located in Chatelet les Halles, Paris. Taking care of the customers, making sure all goes well, training the new employees ; it has been a great ride. Through this, and others work experiences, I have learned how to cope under extreme pressure and rushs. I have acquiered a lot of patience, team spirit, adaptability to different situations, and much more.

work.title: Cook ~ teaching assistant ~ translator
work.description: I have been very fortunate to be part of the staff during a few intense TTCs (Teacher Training Course) in the Ashram in France, as well as in Tyrol, Austria. I would cook (and/or help) everyday, assist the teachers when assistance was needed, as well as a live translator (French to English, and vice versa) for the international TTC.

projects.title: Wildo Codak
projects.category: A first school project, a photographers blog. Done only with HTML/CSS/Bootstrap. We have mostly worked together, on the same computer.

projects.title: Wild Source
projects.category: (offline now // github link) This is a teamwork project for the Wild Code School. It is a platform with an intuitive interface for students to have an easy access to all the lessons, and a simplified back-office for the trainers to easily update their content.

projects.title: Siouplait
projects.category: Final project, an app for quick service in ordering food and drinks. (best seen in phone view)

testimonials.text: She might be fresh out of coding school, but she knows her way. I have been working along side her, and her energy and positivity is infectious! She's a great team player.
A very passionnate hard working person. I can tell you that when it comes to dealing with pressure, and rushes, she has got everything under control. Great add to a team!
